multiobsmethod.title: Multi obs method
multiobsmethod.description:
* **""**: no multiobs 
 * **"full"**: giving one spectra by observation to the lib 
 * **"merge"**: merge observations in a single spectra

lambdarange.title: Lambda range in Angstroms. Is a array (range) for mono obs, and a dictionary of ranges for multiobs

airvacuum_method.title: Air vaccum method
airvacuum_method.description: Method to apply for the air to vacuum wavelength conversion when reading input spectrum. Currently "default" method corresponds to Morton2000

extremaredshiftseparation.title: Extrema redshift separation
extremaredshiftseparation.description: Minimal distance between two extrema (currently not used with linemodel)

smoothWidth.title: smooth width
smoothWidth.description: Number of elements over which to apply spectrum continuum smoothing (half kernel width).

autocorrectinput.title: Wether to correct input spectrum
autocorrectinput.description: Wether to apply a flux/noise correction on input spectrum

objects.title: List of objects to process. All mentioned objects must have dedicated section.

photometryTransmissionDir.title: Photometry transmission directory
photometryTransmissionDir.description: Path containing the photometric transmission bands (one per file). If relative, path is relative to calibration directory. Mandatory if enablePhotometry is set to True. Raises a warning if present but enablePhotometry is set to False.

photometryBand.title: Photometry band
photometryBand.description: List of the band names to use. The name is contained in each band file, and should have the same name than the photometric data contained in the input spectra

filters.title: Filters
filters.description:
List of filters to apply for pixel selection on spectra.
 Example: we want to select the pixels for which 
 1. flag corresponding to 8 is absent 
 2. flag corresponding to 4 is present or flag is 0 : 
 [{"key": "Flag", "instruction": "^", "value": "8"}, {"key": "Flag", "instruction": "0&", "value": "4"}]

key.title: Column name
key.description: Name of the spectrum column to filter on

instruction.title: Comparison type
instruction.description:
* **in**: value must the be a list of possible value 
 * **~in**: not in 
 * **!=**: different 
 * **&**: binary and 
 * **0&**: binary and or 0 
 * **^**: xor

value.title: Value to compare with
value.description: Possible values are int - float - list of numbers (for `in` and `!in` only)

additional_cols.title: Additional columns
additional_cols.description: List of spectrum columns to take into account addtionally to "Wave" "Flux" "Err". Ex: ["Flags"] If you want to filter incoming spectra depending on column a column named Flags

ebmv.title: b minus v
ebmv.description: b minus v: color ratio, used to calculate ISM extinction curve.
